alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; Coastal Wakulla; Gadsden; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Inland Wakulla; Leon; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 12:59PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Gulf, Wakulla, Gadsden, southeastern Liberty, Leon and Franklin Counties through 130 PM EDT/1230 PM CDT/... At 1258 PM EDT/1158 AM CDT/, residual wind gusts to near 40 mph were trailing and earlier line of thunderstorms. Doppler radar and obervations indicated the winds were tracking along a line extending from 12 miles east of Havana to 6 miles northwest of Crawfordville to 10 miles southwest of St George Island. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tallahassee, Carrabelle, Florida State University, Eastpoint, Apalachicola, Tallahassee Community College, Quincy, Havana, Midway, Crawfordville, Florida A and M, St George Island, Port St. Joe, Doak Campbell Stadium, Greensboro, Franklin, Gretna, Sopchoppy, Lake Bradford and Jewel Fire Tower. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT/200 PM CDT/ for Big Bend of Florida.
